project.name: stay
project.description: Stay is a small but effective library for the creation of dynamic xhr-driven web applications.

Stay.name: Stay
Stay.description: The Stay module is the class.

Stay.name: Stay
Stay.description:
The Stay XHR System.

Used for requesting page content asynchronously
while staying on the same page.

Each request can have a hard timeout to avoid endless
loading times that are often deemed to fail anyways.

throws.description: An error is thrown if asynchronous requests are not supported.

props.name: responseFields
props.description: - The content container IDs. These have to be the same as the data fields in the server response.

props.name: infix
props.description: - The special url pattern infix for the asynchronous content requests.

props.name: timeoutPost
props.description: - Hard timeout for POST. 0 means no timeout.

props.name: timeoutGet
props.description: - Hard timeout for GET. 0 means no timeout.

props.name: autoUpdate
props.description: - Whether Stay should automatically update the page content.

classitems.description:
Use the native browser url parsing mechanism
to retrieve the parts of a url.
classitems.name: getUrlParts

return.description: An object containing the url parts.

classitems.description: Regular expression to check if a url is local.
classitems.name: local

classitems.description:
The response fields are the IDs of the DOM elements
that need to be filled with the server response fields.
classitems.name: responseFields

classitems.description: The infix to use for the asynchronous requests.
classitems.name: infix

classitems.description: POST timeout.
classitems.name: timeoutPost

classitems.description: GET timeout.
classitems.name: timeoutGet

classitems.description: Auto update flag.
classitems.name: autoUpdate

classitems.description: Lock flag.
classitems.name: locked

classitems.description: Back-forward flag.
classitems.name: backForward

classitems.description: The current absolute path.
classitems.name: absolutePath

classitems.description: A list of references to the response field DOM elements.
classitems.name: containers

classitems.description:
A container which is filled by setting its innerHTML.
The created DOM elements are taken from this container
and appended to the response fields.
classitems.name: intermediateContainer

classitems.description: A list of navigation listeners for unbinding.
classitems.name: navigationListeners

classitems.description: Signalises that a page navigation has started.
classitems.name: navigate

classitems.description: Returns the parsed server response.
classitems.name: receive

params.name: response
params.description: - The server response, ready to be inserted into the respective response fields.

params.name: status
params.description: - The status of the xhr response.

classitems.description: Signalises that a page update has finished.
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: The internal XMLHttpRequest instance.
classitems.name: xhr

classitems.description: Triggers the internal response handler.
classitems.name: handleResponse

classitems.description: Handles xhr timeouts, ignores the event object.
classitems.name: handleTimeout

classitems.description:
Support browser functionality "back" and "forward".
Depends on the boolean variable "locked" in order to
determine whether this navigation should be executed.
The "backForward" flag tells the system that the next
state mustn't be pushed.
classitems.name: handleBackForward

classitems.description:
This function is bound to all links and forms
and executes the desired page navigation on left clicks.
classitems.name: _switchPage

classitems.description: Adds a response field.
classitems.name: addResponseField

classitems.description: Removes a response field.
classitems.name: removeResponseField

classitems.description: Navigates to the next target uri.
classitems.name: _navigate

params.name: firingElement
params.description: - The element on which the click event occured.

classitems.description: Updates the containers with the new data.
classitems.name: _updateView

params.name: response
params.description: - The response to display. Assumed to contain the data fields specified in "responseFields".

classitems.description:
Binds event listeners to all links and forms.
This method is combined with the cleanup and basically refreshes 
the navigation listeners.
classitems.name: _updateListeners

classitems.description:
Updates the view, the navigation listeners and the history state.
Also emits an event to signilize that the page has been loaded.

The update function needs to be called after each navigation in 
order to unlock the system. This happens by default, but that
behaviour can be disabled. It is then the responsibility of the
programmer to call stay.update() with the response data provided 
by the "receive" event.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description:
This function acts when the xhr object changes its readyState.
The response will be a json object or an error page. Anything else will 
be caught as a json parse exception and announced in the first response field.
classitems.name: _handleResponse

params.name: xhr
params.description: - The xhr object that fired the event.

classitems.description: Enumeration of Error Messages.
classitems.name: Error
